document.masterDocTitle: The Yponomeutidae of the Afrotropical region (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Yponomeutidae of the Afrotropical region (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Hyponomeuta subplumbella Walsingham, 1881: 248–249
, pl. XI f. 16.

bibRefCitation.author: Viette, P.
bibRefCitation.refString: Viette, P. (1954) Nouveaux Tineoidea (s. l.) de Madagascar. Annales de la Societe Entomologique de France, 123, 82 - 83.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality: Republic of South Africa : Kwazulu Natal , Estcourt
.

Redescription of adult ( Plate 2 ). Wingspan 14–20 mm . Head pale grey, labial palpus long and slender, whitish grey, segment 2 just longer than segment 3; scape and antenna grey. Thorax grey with five black spots, tegula grey with one black spot. Forewing narrow, grey with a black spot in middle near base, three rows of black spots, subcostal, along fold and subdorsal, fringe concolorous with wing. Hindwing grey. Abdomen and legs pale grey.
Variation. The forewing ground colour varies from plain grey to grey sprinkled with whitish and dark scales.

Diagnosis. Distinguished from most other narrow winged species by the more or less uniform greyish ground colour of the forewing. In the male genitalia the straight costa of the valva is diagnostic, in the female the inwardly pointing lobes of the lamella postvaginalis separate the species from
superplumbella .

Biology. The species has been reared from
Gymnosporia
fruits or
Maytenus ,
larvae feeding gregariously in a web.
Distribution. Republic of Republic of South Africa , Swaziland , Zimbabwe , Madagascar , Tanzania , Kenya .

Type material.
Type in NHMUK, not located.

Remarks. The holotype specimen of
malgasella Viette
in MNHNP was examined with its genitalia slide, and found to be identical to
subplumbella ,
hence the synonymy.
